channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hollywood video game performers are going on strike because they worry studios could train AI to copy them
item.description: The move comes after nearly two years of negotiations with gaming giants, including divisions of Activision, Warner Bros. and Walt Disney, over a new interactive media agreement.

item.title: Novo Nordisk's Wegovy wins EU backing for reducing heart risks
item.description: Novo Nordisk's Wegovy has received backing from the EU's medical regulator to expand the weight loss drug's use to reducing the rise of serious heart events.

item.title: Liquidation of crowded trades is healthy but levels must hold: Bank America
Kamala Harris can rebuild the crypto bridges burned by Biden—but time is of the essence
item.description: Two progressive Democrats have some advice for their party's soon-to-be Presidential nominee.

item.title: Friday's analyst calls: Apple a buy ahead of earnings, food delivery stock to surge more than 60%
item.description: Apple and a food delivery stock were among the names being talked about by analysts on Friday.

item.title: Dow futures rise after worst three-day stretch for S&P 500 in nine months
Unilever customers swallowing ‘carry-over pricing’ from historic inflation helped it generate $6.4 billion in profits so far this year
item.description: The Ben & Jerry's owner says its starting to see negative pricing in some markets, but Europeans are still absorbing the group's rising costs.

item.title: Obama endorses Kamala Harris as she builds momentum against Donald Trump
item.description: The Obamas' highly anticipated endorsement could give Harris campaign a boost as it builds momentum to rival that of Donald Trump.

item.title: Podcast: What the CrowdStrike outage means for investing in cybersecurity
Spain poised to become Europe’s data center capital as Amazon and Meta invest billions to kickstart development
item.description: Developing more industries and businesses in emptier regions in Spain is a major common goal across the political aisle.

item.title: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix to build $6.8 billion chip plant in South Korea
item.description: SK Hynix's plant will be in the Yongin Semiconductor Cluster where the South Korean government is looking to build a massive complex of chip operations.

item.title: The CrowdStrike chaos will happen again. Here’s why.
Empty nesters are sad to see their kids leave the house. They can be even more distressed when they return home
item.description: Why grown kids moving back home can be a big adjustment for parents.

item.title: CrowdStrike CEO says 97% of Windows sensors back online after major outage
item.description: Last week, CrowdStrike issued a routine update to its users around the world that contained a bug which caused Microsoft's Windows operating system to crash.

item.title: Dow ends higher, Nasdaq logs 3-day drop on Big Tech retreat
